text: When I open to the fridge this morning I found nothing except for some leftover Pho noodles and some eggs
So I thought why not make some Pho omelette it's called "Phở chiên trứng" in Vietnamese. Let's begin
Firstly separate the noodles with your hands to make sure that there's no string of noodles sticking to each other
For one serving. You're gonna need about 150 gram or
five ounces
Next crack two eggs in a small bowl and add a teaspoon of fish sauce and some freshly cracked pepper
beat well
Fill a sauce pan with vegetable oil just enough to cover the base and then gently drop in the noodles
Use chopsticks to spread the noodles
Evenly over the base
This is my trick to prevent the oil splashing all over the place
I cut out the bottom of a carton box and just put it around the pan like this
Fry until one side is golden brown. It's gonna take about seven to ten minutes
Then we're gonna flip it over
And fry the other side for a couple more minutes
Next pour the eggs mixture over the surface and let it fill the holes that the noodles created
You might need to flip a couple more times until both sides turn golden brown and crispy
Too little oil is not enough to crisps up the noodles but too much oil might make them limp
So use just the right amount that is enough to cover the base
When it's almost there, you can ask some chopped green onions and fry for one more minutes and it's done
Transfer to rest on a rack and let the excess oil drip off.
To balance out the greasiness. I like to serve this Pho omelette with some
pickled daikons and carrots which I have shredded and then
Mixed with some vinegar and sugar a few squirts of sriracha and you're good to go
It's crispy and fragrant and combined with that
Sweet and sour pickles is the perfect bite
I hope you like it
And if you give it a try please put a photo on instagram with hashtag #Helenrecipes. I would love to see it
This recipe together with so many other Pho and noodle recipes can be found in my cookbook
Simply Pho which is available now on Amazon and/or other bookstores on and offline
You can click on the link to grab one now if you haven't already
Otherwise just click subscribe and turn on the bell button. So you won't miss my next video when it comes out. Thank you for watching
